TextSection.Contents: SUNCT syndrome (Short-lasting Unilateral Neuralgiform headache attacks with Conjunctival injection and Tearing) is a primary headache disorder characterized by unilateral trigeminal pain that occurs in association with ipsilateral cranial autonomic symptoms (conjunctival injection and tearing).

Synonym.label: Short-lasting unilateral neuralgiform headache attacks with conjunctival injection and tearing
